intro: Sisymbrium pinnatum var. brachycarpon, commonly known as narrowpod wild radish, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, followed by elongated, narrow pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
